summary: Adjust the Artist Leaderboard UI to remove the profile picture/avatar icon, make the row/card boxes sharper (less rounded, more crisp edges), and add music + business-themed aesthetic elements in the right-side corners, while keeping the light-blue background direction and top-10 American flag indicators.
architectural_notes: Visual direction change: shift from neon-accent dark glassmorphism to Indian-inspired mandala pattern + coffee minimal minimalism while retaining existing layout/data elements.
Background color direction change requested: switch leaderboard background to light blue (may conflict with existing dark-mode/coffee-toned mandala styling).
Top-10 artists should display an American flag indicator; implement using non-photo assets (icon/emoji/SVG), not photographic images.
Leaderboard rows should not display a profile picture/avatar icon.
Update box/card styling to use sharper corners (less rounded).
Add music + business themed corner accents on the right side (likely via small non-photo icon/SVG assets).

existing_features.title: Create a dedicated "Artist Leaderboard" screen in the React app that renders a leaderboard list with glassmorphism row styling on a sleek dark-mode background.
Each leaderboard row must display: (1) a bold serial number, (2) an artist avatar, (3) the artist name, and (4) a "Reach Score" column with a numeric value.

Add a ranking-shift visualization per row that compares current data to previous data and displays a vibrant green up-arrow for positive movement and a red down-arrow for negative movement (and a neutral state for no change).
Implement a modular component structure for the leaderboard (e.g., separate components for the leaderboard container, header/columns, and individual artist row) to make the layout easy to extend.
Add a vibrant indie, neon-accented "Hype" indicator for top-trending artists that stands out from other rows while still fitting the dark glassmorphism aesthetic.

Apply a consistent visual theme across the leaderboard (color tokens, typography scale, spacing, borders, and hover/focus states) that matches a sleek dark-mode + neon-accent glassmorphism style (avoid default blue/purple accents unless explicitly needed).

Update the Artist Leaderboard visual theme from neon cyber/glassmorphism to an Indian-inspired design that uses mandala pattern motifs and a coffee-toned minimalistic aesthetic, while keeping all existing leaderboard information and layout structure intact.

Introduce a mandala pattern as a subtle background layer for the Artist Leaderboard page and/or cards (e.g., faint, low-contrast, tiled or centered), implemented via a generated static image asset and applied in a way that preserves readability in dark mode.

Refactor existing leaderboard component styling (page header, row rank badge, avatar border/fallback, hype badge, glassmorphism card styles, and shadows) to match the coffee minimal palette and mandala-inspired aesthetic, using the existing Tailwind/CSS variable token approach.
Update the Artist Leaderboard page background to be light blue instead of the current dark/coffee-toned background.

Ensure the Artist Leaderboard page remains readable and visually consistent after switching the background to light blue (including text colors, card contrast, and the mandala/paper texture overlay layers).
Update the sample artist leaderboard data so that the first leaderboard entry (rank 1) has the artist name "Atif Aslam" and the second leaderboard entry (rank 2) has the artist name "Arijit Singh".

Add an American flag indicator for the top 10 artists on the Artist Leaderboard, displayed inline with each artistâ€™s name area in both mobile and desktop row layouts (without changing existing rank, avatar, Reach Score, Trend, and Hype indicator behavior).
Implement the American flag indicator using a non-photo asset (flat icon/SVG/illustration) served as a static frontend asset (not fetched as a photo and not routed through the backend).

Remove the profile picture/avatar icon from each Artist Leaderboard row in both mobile and desktop layouts, without changing existing rank, artist name, Reach Score, trend indicator, Hype badge, or top-10 US flag behavior.
Sharpen the leaderboard row/card boxes by reducing corner rounding and making edges look crisper, while keeping the current light-blue background theme and overall readability.

Add subtle music-themed and business-themed aesthetic elements as decorative right-corner accents in the Artist Leaderboard UI, implemented using generated static image assets and styled to match the existing light-blue + coffee/saffron/copper palette.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a dark-mode 'Artist Leaderboard' with glassmorphism rows including serial number, artist avatar/name, Reach Score column, up/down ranking shift arrows, modular layout, and neon 'Hype' indicator for top-trending artists.
Update the leaderboard visual theme to an Indian-inspired design with mandala patterns and a coffee-toned minimalistic aesthetic.
Change the Artist Leaderboard page background to light blue (replacing the prior light pink request).
Update the first two leaderboard entries to use the artist names "Atif Aslam" (1st) and "Arijit Singh" (2nd).
Add American flag indicators for the top 10 artists on the leaderboard, using non-photo assets (e.g., icon/emoji/SVG) rather than photos.
Remove the profile picture/avatar icon from each leaderboard row.
Sharpen the leaderboard row/card boxes (crisper edges; reduce rounded corners).
Add music- and business-themed aesthetic elements in the right corners of the leaderboard UI.
